name: Hustyns - A CLC World Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Last week I decided to look on trip advisor for photo's of the cottages at Hustyns before arriving for our long weekend break, but there were none. So for those who are like me and want to see photo's of their destination before arriving before, I have place a few along with with review for you to have a look at.
reviews.title: Great Cottage, Great Stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like other advisors mentioned there are the sales teams who can be quite pushy, just be very direct and say no thank you and leave it at that. Ours Sales Advisor got a bit moody I was not the slightest bothered, we are prelude members and do not want to spend £20,000 to become full members .
reviews.title: Fantastic - can't recommend more highly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort is lovely and the cottage was wonderful, I would highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Too far from civilization

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011
reviews.text: Happy Stay
reviews.title: Nice but watch the sales talk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything was fantastic. The rooms were very comfortable and well furnished. Bathroom was large and modern with great shower. Restaurant was beautifully located and food very good. Staff very helpful. Facilities couldn't be better.
reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: we absolutely enjoyed staying in lovely large room with our kids aged 8 and 12 at this hotel. Gorgeous gardens, woods, and surrounds and extremely helpful, friendly staff. Absolutely one of the best hotels I have ever, ever stayed in the UK. There were some worries that someone might pitch a timeshare at us but there was nary a mention of that. We took a great bike ride, organized by hotel down through the woods to the Camel Trail and into Padestow we we had Rick Stein's Fish and Chip plus tried his pastie (the best cheese and onion pastie we had ever tried). Breakfast was good although it took us a day to realize we could also order omlettes etc. Only one tiny weeny niggle. I would like to see a healthier menu with fewer chips (what about boiled potatoes etc) on the menu. This hotel has a veggie and herb garden and I would love to see that reflected in the menu. More salads please and what about some of Mr Stein's pasties on the menu. It's only a small niggle but I work in food activism and know there's some fab local food around this area. Also would like a plunge coffee maker in the room but everything else about this place is superlative!
reviews.title: Lovely spot, great for families, bike rides..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took a long weekend break, booking ourselves into Hustyns (Hotel). Location was superb, just the right balance away from civilisation, and yet still close to local towns. Hotel was fantastic; staff were extremely friendly from the minute we arrived. Rooms was a very good size, and bathroom was amazing!! We enjoyed the spa, both having a back massage - very professional team who thoroughly looked after us. The grounds are beautiful too. We enjoyed a meal in the restuarant whilst an acoustic guitarist entertained. The staff couldnt have been more friendly. Breakfast both mornings were amazing - a full english breakfast available, along with cereals, fruit and snacks. Overall this was a brilliant hotel, I would recommend to both families and couples. I will definitely be going back!!!
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: As with many people submitting reviews, we stayed at Hustyns on a 5 day promotion, buy for just short of £200 in August we couldn't say no! Our family room was huge, with a lovely, clean bathroom.
reviews.title: Lovely top quality accommodation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our 'presentation' was on the Wednesday so we had a few days to enjoy the hotel/surrounding area before we psyched ourselves up for the hard sell that never came! Our salesman was lovely, friendly and good company. Yes, his manager had to come over and give us the usual blurb (and I must admit we were interested in hearing more, having owned timeshares in the past), but once we had decided the answer was 'no' we weren't pressured at all and left still feeling positive about the whole experience. One thing to point out though, if you do go on a promotional break, it won't be 90 minutes!! Ours lasted a pleasant 3 hours which included full free breakfast. Our boys are now old enough that we let them go off swimming whilst we had the sales talk, I would imagine it would've been a slightly less enjoyable 3 hour experience if we'd have had bored school children to entertain!
reviews.title: LOVELY HOTEL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011
reviews.text: Wadebridge is lovely as is the surrounding area.
reviews.title: A very fair promotional weekend with no hard sell.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my Partner just returned from a lovely weekend away in cornwall. We stayed at Hustyns, part of the club la costa group. Part of the promotional stay was to sit through a sales presentation....obviously we werent looking forward to this, but those who are planning on a visit- dont be put off. What they had to offer was very interesting and very surprising as we had many assumptions about what we were going to be sold before we arrived. The sales rep was very friendly and not at all pushy- even gave us a nice afternoon tea! We decided to buy into the concept and cant wait for our first holiday. Fantastic weekend! thanks Hustyns and Club la costa
reviews.title: LOVED HUSTYNS...EVEN THE PRESENTATION WAS ENOYABLE- DONT BE PUT OFF

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a long weekend at Hustyns and could not wait to write this review. Basically myself and my partner stayed at Hustyns for one of their promotional stays and had 3 lovely days staying in a splendid hotel visiting the beautiful sites of Cornwall. Unfortunately this was to be a distant memory after enduring the CLC presentation.
reviews.title: Nice place but very PUSHY sales team!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The first sales rep was very pleasant and detailed the benefits of joining such an exclusive
reviews.title: Peaceful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: membership, but the more we said NO, the more we were confronted by senior staff members who kept trying to belittle us and made us at times feel very uncomfortable.
reviews.title: Told we would be in a self catering room!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Apparently the presentation was supposed to last for a duration of 90 minutes, my partner had to say after 3 hours!!!! that enough was enough and that we were not interested! But they still persisted with the sales talk, BLA, BLA, BLA (lots of yawns later)...and finally after 3 AND A HALF HOURS!!!! it all ended with my partner declining the opportunity of becoming such a member.
reviews.title: relaxing and very plush

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a weekend break, very nice secluded location, excellent service and facilities, all very clean, large rooms, can't fault it.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I have just returned from a nights stay at Hustyns and we were absolutely over the moon with this hotel. From the moment we stepped foot in the hotel the staff were so polite and helpful. Our room was amazing, clean, crisp white towels and robes, full tea and coffee making facilitys etc. The room was decorated lovely, and the bed was super comfortable and the room so quiet, no noise from other rooms or passers by. Very spacious bathroom with massive shower and bath. Very impressed. We ate in the Brasserie, food was excellent and the gentleman called Jack who served us was absolutly brilliant, friendly, welcoming and very very helpful. We had breakfast in the morning also which again, couldn't fault it what so ever. We used the lesiure facilitys whilst we were there, gym was very nice clean and good selection of equipment and the pool was lovely. We only live locally to this hotel (about an hours drive) but we will definatly be returning again!!
reviews.title: Will Definatly Be Visiting Again!! :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a week in the hotel from Friday 30th Dec, 2011. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. Had a great night New Year's eve' with a lovely dinner. Leisure centre is excellent, room spacious. Phone signal is weak, as is wi-Di apart from certain areas where boosters are fitted, but at least work couldn't spoil our stay :-).
reviews.title: New Year's stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a good base for exploring the North and South coast of Cornwall. Padstow was a favourite location and we recommend trying Rick steins Seafood Restaurant, which is pricey but worth it. Book early though.
reviews.title: Great place to disappear to

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the usual phone call saying we had won a holiday in Cornwall. I let out a sigh and wanted to say "go away" but wasn't quick enough. I was talked into a four night break for two for £79. I said there was no way financially we could afford to buy into a timeshare but was promised there would be no hard sell. The drive to the hotel was quite an experience. When the satnav said "turn left" we said "no way" but it was correct. Most of the last five miles to the hotel are one vehicle only lanes so if you are of a nervous disposition perhaps this isn't the place for you. However, we arrived in one piece and by the end of the four days the journey to the hotel was a doddle. Very friendly people at the hotel. Our room was really nice. It overlooked the car park but that didn't affect us at all. We ate there the first night. Service was excellent, as was the food. The only place your mobile will work is in the restaurant/bar area so if you want to disappear for a few days, this hotel is ideal. The timeshare talk went on a bit. I liked the salesman (Jason) but it annoyed me when he kept on calling over the Manageress, then the Financial Manageress, then back to him and then again and again. Anyway, the tour around the cottages was very interesting. These cottages are out of this World but way too expensive for us to join the Club and pay the yearly fee. We managed to say no and although they were disappointed, they "agreed we could leave the Talk"(!) At the end of the day, this is a Members' only hotel and so the standards have got to be high but at no time did we feel out of place and were treated with respect at all times.
reviews.title: Great Cheap Long Weekend

description: Surrounded by 100 acres of beautifully landscaped private gardens and woodlands, Hustyns luxury country hotel enjoys panoramic views over North Cornwall’s legendary Bodmin Moor. Guests are encouraged to treat the resort as their private haven of tranquillity, far from the fastmoving modern world. To help you relax, the well-equipped health and beauty spa offers an indoor swimming pool and, for guests over 16 years old, a gymnasium, spa baths, steam room and sauna, with beauty therapists on hand to pamper your worries away.
